object.property: Normally, the encoding specified above will only be used when importing new tracks, and for any operations involving existing tracks, the encoding specified when the file was first imported will be used. You can use the options below to override this behavior, in case you specified the encoding incorrectly for the first import.
Also use this encoding when updating or synchronizing tracks
Also use this encoding when writing tracks

You can separate several templates by a ';'. The first one matching the filename will be used. Example: %a - %A/%T %t.mp3;%t.wav. - artist: %a - album: %A - composer: %c - title: %t - genre: %G - track nr: %T - CD nr: %C - year: %Y - skip data: %* - the character '%': %%.

You can separate several templates by a ';'. The first one matching the filename will be used. Examples: - folder.jpg: Use folder.jpg as cover art. - folder: Use folder.jpg, folder.png... - ../%A.jpg: Use <Album>.jpg in the parent directory - %A: Use <Album>.jpg, <Album>.png... - folder.jpg;%a.jpg: First try folder.jpg, then <artist>.jpg - artist: %a - album: %A - composer: %c - title: %t - genre: %G - track nr: %T - CD nr: %C - year: %Y - skip data: %* - the character '%': %%.
Provide a shell command to generate a thumbnail image of your video file. The following format strings will be expanded: - %f: the input file - %o: the output file (which is automatically generated)
Add file masks to be excluded from import and synchronization, for example, *.mp3.
Convert compatible formats to a single format
These settings will only be applied to newly added or updated tracks. This could result in tracks that are normalized to different levels until updated.
Delete missing tracks when synchronizing playlists

When multiple tracks are added to a repository, should an error occur then it is likely, without saving all added tracks will be lost since they are not saved. This preference allows for a save operation to be conducted after the number of tracks specified.
The default is 10 so after 10 tracks have been added a save will be imposed on the repository.
Threshold for import of tracks before a save triggered:
Update information about the existing track
When Attempting to Add an Existing Track
Include tracks never played in the "Best Rated" playlist
Read embedded tags from music files
Parse file name to set missing tags
Set still missing tags to file name
Mass-modify tags when multiple tracks are selected
Write tags to disk when edited
Use legacy format for MP3 tags
Add cover art using file name template
Confirm deletion of playlists or tracks from a playlist
Confirm deletion of tracks during synchronization
Display messages and warnings at startup
Display information about detected duplicate files
